Description: Gorgoneion coffin-fitting with traces of white coating and black paint. Fine red-brown fabric with a buff core and very fine white and black inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

campanian early 5th bc Vassilika, E. (1998) Greek and Roman Art (1998) [comments: p.44-45, no.20] Martin-von-Wagner-Museum der Universität Würzburg (Schmidt 1994, pl.41, no.224) . Schmidt, E. 1994, Katalog der antiken Terrakotten I. Die figürlichen Terrakotten, Martin-von-Wagner-Museum der Universität Würzburg, Mainz.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DE.003) (Phase 2)
